MarkerCategory.name: stack
MarkerCategory.info: Hit F to make the mark disappear.

POI.info: Have someone select the path while the others move down to the Spider Queen area.
Take out the other spiders before killing the low level spiders, which summon the Spider Queen. When fighting her, bring condi cleanse.
Lure the mob back here and kill them before running past the traps.
Arrows mark the generally safe areas. Disable the traps with the chain. If the Troll spawns on the way to the next boss, run past it.
Interact with the chains to disable traps.
Stack in the corner and pull the boss.
P1: Hodgins - Start
Wait for the fire blasts to pass, then run down the stairs, or you can jump on the heads and run down on them.
Arrows mark the burrow spawns.
With blinks and teleports you can get to the scepter faster after the graveling event finishes. Return to the center WP.
Grab scepter piece and then WP to the center/Foefire's Heart.
P1: Hodgins - Part 2
Avoid that side to prevent the ooze from spawning.
Collect the scepter pieces at Arrows and turn them in here.

P1: Arrows mark the general area for the pieces. Stealth is nice. Bring speed and stun breakers to deal with the knockdowns. Also kill the mob near the first piece to prevent Hodgins from running off.
P1: Hodgins - Part 3 - After turning in the pieces.
Stealth is nice. Bring stun breakers and run past the mobs.
P2: Detha - Start

Have people stack on Arrow and cleave the mob once Detha triggers the event. Once it finishes WP back to the center/Foefire's Heart. If you don't see Detha and everyone is together, run back to the POI and hopefully she'll appear. You can use the chains to trigger the spike traps if the group's dps isn't good.
Hit F to make the marker disappear.
P2: Detha - Part 2
Interact with the chain to open the gate.
If Detha hasn't followed, pull back here or a bit further and she should spawn, then you can move back and it should trigger the defense trap event.

Defend Detha as she sets up the trap. Then talk to her to start the next event where you use the gun to lift the ectoplasmic oozes into the traps to charge it. You can use personal pulls to group the oozes faster for lifting. Once the trap is charged, lure the boss on to it and kill it when it's no longer a blue ghost.
P3: Tzark - Start
Kill each of the burrows as they spawn then after the last one go to the door.
P3: Tzark - Part 2
Have someone run ahead to trigger the event and kill the burrow to the right. After killing all the burrows and getting out of combat, you can WP to the newly unlocked WP in the Rockfall Chamber.
P3: Tzark - Part 3
P1: Asura - Start - Talk to Traffa then interact with the golem in the courtyard which opens the door.
It is possible to use stealth and solo the asuran devices. Otherwise, go as a group and clear the mobs and interact with the tech.
Clear the wing nearest to the waypoint before following the trail.
Go into the rooms to fight. Most adds can't be pulled/grouped up.

It is possible cutscene hold (let the scene play out while the rest of the group skips watching it) and prevent the bandits from instantly spawning before the group enters the barn. Run up the rafters to the top and murder the bandit snipers before dropping down for the boss.
P1: You can blink into the barn.
P1: Asura - Part 2
After killing the boss, back track and follow Part 3/General Path.
P1: Asura - Part 3
You can stealth past or pull and murder the mobs. If you don't have a long stealth duration, run across the top instead.
Pull and murder the remaining mobs here.
Ranged and condi are good for fighting Frost. Golems activate at 75/50/25. Dodge turret fire and avoid getting frozen in place.
P2: Seraph - Start
Clear each room and interact with Seraph before returning to the start and collecting the satchel.
P2: Skip to Satchel
P2: Only if you can't blink to the Satchel by entering the dining room. Talk to Seraph and then WP to the start of the dungeon.
Use the pillows and play hopscotch on top of them to not get impaled.
P2: Seraph- Part 2
Spread out to not get wiped with the swords.
P2: Seraph - Part 3
If you drop a keg far away, the bandits will go after it, making the door part easier. Weapon swap while holding a keg on top of the red circles.
You can reflect on Martha.
Boss hits hard and goes invuln. You can cheese him a bit using the hill to break line of sight.
P3: Butler - Start
P3: Bring stability. Reflects don't work on Boss.
P3: Butler - Part 2
Use reflects. Use gun.
P3: Butler - Part 3
Run off to the door before the boss dies or hug the wall.
Stealth or pull the mobs.
Pull and murder the remaining mobs here.
P3: Clear riflemen before fighting the boss.
P1/P3: General Path
After clearing the adds, you can stealth past the enforcers.
If the group still has aggro, continue running and kill things that follow you out.
Path for Up or Forward
Apply stealth if you want to skip the mobs.
Up Path - Start
Pull spiders and kill them before facing the boss. Boss has projectile attack which hits hard, spread out or stay at ranged to avoid a group wipe.
Stealth is advisable for these parts, otherwise bring stun breakers for the mobs and range for the flowers. If you down, you can rally off the flowers.
Up Path - Part 2
If you aren't aggro'd you can wait here and apply more stealth.
Run into the spider egg sacs before the boss spawns to avoid more adds.
Up Path - Part 3
Stealth is advisable.
Up Path - Part 4
Forward Path - Start
Forward Path - Part 2
Optional: Blink skip at arrow.
Get super close to the crack and target the blink skill on the other side.
Watch the cog and wait for it to be in a bubble and then walk into the blue portals to get inside the bubbles. Do not collide with the bubble or you will go down.
Forward Path - Part 3
Optional: Stealth past the mobs.
Optional: (Wait for CDs) and stealth past the mobs. If you go down in the tunnel, you can rally off the flowers.
Forward Path - Part 4
Aetherblade Path - Start

Use the plants to lure the ooze to the door and gears while protecting them from the elementals. You can cheese this with a rev and use the tablet bubble. Aggro both oozes and everyone else aggro the elementals. Guide the oozes to the gear then step over fire with the 2nd one for the other gear.
Aether - Part 2
Kill the robot first. You can lure the ooze to oil to cleanse it.
Aether - Part 3
Kill enemies on top of the generators to break them.
Pull the boss over here.
Aether - Part 4

Everyone should stow or dismiss their minons or pets. Avoid the electric floor while getting to the pad. When all of the pads are occupied by a person, a Holographic Thug spawns. Stay on the pads while luring him to the control panel and killing him there.
Aether - Part 5

Kill 8 Generators. Use the Pads to avoid the electric floor. After the cutscene ends, QUICKLY dodge out of the death gears. The gears last a long time. If the boss builds up shielding, remove it by killing an aetherblade on him.
Aether Chests after the dungeon is complete. You must have a key to open each chest. The path will also seal if you take too long.
P1: Fergg - Start

Jump to the right and wait for a group of enemies to pass, then jump back and break the gates. The very last set of gates near the end can be run through.The patrols infinitely respawn and aren't worth killing.
Boss has knockbacks and stuns. Enemies also infinitely respawn from this area.
Avoid the mines (white lumps) and the golems which can one shot most players. Stealth prevents mines from triggering
Bring reflects, condi clear, and cleave the golems together. If the group can't handle them, try pulling one golem at a time to kill.
If the group is bad, you can have someone hold the cutscene by watching it. The rest of the group skips it and fights Troop Commander Kaeyi. This makes the Tazza fight easier.
P2: Rasolov - Start
If the door isn't open, interact with the chains to the left.
Attack the generals.
P2: Rasolov - Part 2
Kite the boss under the smasher to break his shield. Afterwards, collect rocks for Rasolov and turn them in at the car.
P2: Rasolov - Part 3
Careful dropping down.
When the boss spawns, you must kill the robots around the same time. There will be a buff that swaps around making one of the golems immune to cc and direct damage.
P3: Koptev - Start
You can drag the boss near the wall and cleave or you can fast DPS him down where he is.
Get out of combat, heal, and prepare to fall.
You can run straight ahead or divert left and circle around to reach the boss.
Optional: Long away around to get out of combat.
He will sometimes cause a fire field around the player, you can remove it by walking to a water geyser.
He will sometimes cause a fire field around the player, you can remove it by walking to a water geyser.
P3: Koptev - Part 2
Bring reflects and focus the car. Knock them away or pull them off the car. When the door opens, run.
You can pull the mobs here and cleave them. (Interact to remove)
You can pull the mobs here and cleave them. (Interact to remove)
P1: The Butcher - Start
You can run past this event to the stairs.
Troll has knockdown and can hit hard, bring stun breakers and stability.
Wolves hit hard and have knockdown. Bring stability.
P1: The Butcher - Part 2
Boss has a mechanic where he reflects projectiles and absorbs attacks. Attacks will remove the buff from him. Watch out for his ice field and the adds he summons.
P1: The Butcher - Part 3
Avoid the red circles or be sent back to the start. Stay to the edges.
P1: The Butcher - Part 4
Totems give the boss boons. Prioritize killing the protection totem. If your team is condi, take out resolution totem instead. Pull the boss over and you can cleave them both.
P2: The Plunderer - Start
Most of the adds nearby stay out of the fight. Boss has a few knockdowns/backs but doesn't hit too hard.
Can be ignored but might chase after, making the next boss fight harder. Stay out of his charge knockdown and his icy trail AoE.
Boss can fear you off the ship so fight him with your back against something stable. Bring Stability and Stun breakers.
You can pull the two quaggans and kill them separately. Boss has a high damage cone AoE and drops ice spikes AoE which also hit hard.
P2: The Plunderer - Part 2
Rest of the path is underwater. - If you have a lot of stealth you can sneak past and get into the boss room. Otherwise, it *might* be best to kill the enemies here.
Consider using stealth or killing the enemies.
You might be able to break aggro in the corner, before facing the boss. Boss has a high damage charge attack and will toss mines. Multiple hits from the mines can down a player.
P3: Zealot - Start
You can run past this event to the stairs.
Wolves hit hard and have knockdown. Bring stability.
Boss isn't much of a threat but the totem might shoot knockdown bolts.
P3: Zealot - Part 2
Most attacks are melee; Occasionally howls and immobilizes players.
Recommend: Killing bolt launchers and adds.
Boss has launches and knockdowns, bring stability. Occasionally encases self in ice, break the ice to stop regeneration.
P3: Zealot - Part 3
Rest of the path is underwater. Consider: Stealthing past enemies.
Boss summons: Jellyfish which explode for high AoE damage and Barracuda moderate damage. If you choose to fight him on land on the stairs to the left, he hits a lot harder.
P1: Ferrah - Start
Focus the slave driver. The Effigy will respawn.
P1: Ferrah - Part 2
Kill 10 acolytes. (Acolytes respawn every 40~ seconds) You can ignore everyone else.
P1: Ferrah - Part 3

If you have a blink skill, you move past the locked gate before the event fire boulder room event starts to take out the gate controller and skip the mandatory 5 people for the braziers. After the controller is destroyed, come back to do the flame boulders.

If you are skipping, blink past this gate. To do the fire boulder room, you must take the flame and light 3 braziers at the end within 15 seconds of each other. The flame in your hand will also expire if you take too long holding it. Portals will make this a lot easier.If not, hug the wall and time the boulders to get across.

If no one skipped the section, you must have 4 people continue to stand in the 4 braziers creating a dome. Only then, the 5th player can attack the door controller to progress the dungeon. Once the controller is destroyed, everyone can move off and continue to the boss fight.
Easy fight. The crystals heal the boss by can be ignored with high DPS.
P2: Magg - Start
P2: Magg - Part 2
Focus the nests and go up.
Use the chains.
Have someone wait at Magg while everyone else get to the hard to reach bombs. Once people are in position, talk to the npc to start the event.
P2: Magg - Part 3
Grab a fire extinguisher from Magg. Use it to put out fires when you run across. Stealth helps.
Get everyone over here so Magg will teleport over and look at the orange rock. The waypoint to the Shrine of Sacrifice.
P2: Magg - Part 4
Protect Magg from the spawning mobs and kill assassins.

You can ignore Gaheron Baelfire. Attack the Eternal Flame in the center of the room when the acolytes protecting it are dead. They respawn so time their deaths and then attack the Eternal Flame. Repeat until it's dead.
P3: Rhiannon - Start

You must light 3 torches in a small time frame. If someone has stealth, it makes it easier for them to light the torch without getting interrupted. Otherwise, kill all but one enemy from the group and it shouldn't respawn.
P3: Rhiannon - Part 2
Defend event or if you are really good you can skip it but more than not you'll miss the jump.
P3: Rhiannon - Part 3
Avoid the bombs when they are on, or use stealth. Safe spots are marked with an arrow. You can kill the pet drake and open a new waypoint.

Wait for the cycle and be careful bc team members can trigger the bomb blast. Even if you are in a safe spot, if the bomb is armed the AoE will kill you there. If you see the AoE, dodge to avoid the damage.
Save spot from turrets.
P3: Rhiannon - Part 4 If you are still missing teammates you can kill the pet to get the waypoint up.

Boss can bat you straight into the lava, so stay away from the edges. When he runs to the center, he's about to do the ring attack, dodge towards him as the earth rings popup. Consider bringing stability.
Bring stun breakers and condi cleanse, mobs have knockdowns and chills.

At least two players must make it across. Altogether, 4 people must time the console deactivations within a time window. You don't *need* to turn it off, but if people die, they'll have to jump across again.
One person can do this console by standing in between and channeling them.
General Path - Part 2
Consider killing the boon granting turrets and bringing stun breakers and reflects.
P2: Teleporter / P3: Front door - Start
Cannon Defense after the door opens, run left and wait for the abomination to walk past. Consider using stealth to avoid the mobs.
Wait out the abom, then run past up the stairs.
Crystal can freeze you for a long time. Otherwise, it's like the prior encounter.
P2: Teleporter / P3: Front door - Start
Cannon Defense after the door opens, run left and wait for the abomination to walk past. Consider using stealth to avoid the mobs.
Wait out the abom, then run past up the stairs.
Crystal can freeze you for a long time. Otherwise, it's like the prior encounter in the other paths.
P1: Submarine - Start
Defend people while they channel the console. Easiest way is to have 1 person channel with 4 defenders. Then, kill the elites. Then, have 4 people channel with one defender.
P1: Submarine - Part 2
Overloading the generator is faster.
P1: Submarine - Part 3
Players hide pets and minions to make pulling easier. Kite the boss into running into the pillar before dpsing him down.
P1: Submarine - Part 4
P2: Teleporter - Part 2
Kill any adds that followed you before fighting the Husk. If you have enough dps and heals, you can dps the Husk down. Otherwise, use the guns and lure the golems to explode on the Husk.
P2: Teleporter - Part 3
P3: Front Door - Part 2
Bring condi cleanse and run past the mobs.

3 people need to channel the cannons around the same time to break the shield on the boss. Sometimes an attack will interrupt you channeling the cannon. Once the shield is down, jump down and fight the boss. If you aren't fast enough, the shield will come back up, knocking you into the lava.
P3: Front Door - Part 3
Same fight as before, but the essences will try and heal the boss.
Path 1: Jotun - Start
Use reflects or the crystals to destroy the turrets.

Best to clear the turrets then pull the Ooze boss away from enemies. Melee the ooze. If everyone is super close melee, the boss will only do the 6 bounces in place. When you see it glow yellow, dodge out. Once the boss dies, grab the blood and run to the Jotun.
Path 1: Jotun - Part 2
Pull the Crystalline Entities into the light, CC them, and kill.
Path 1: Jotun - Part 3

4 People stand on the geysers. If you have 3 people, it's possible to have someone shadowstep/blink onto the other geyser to clog it. If the boss is burning on fire, the tar pools won't super long stun. You can use the 300 Year Old Whiskey to burn the boss and allies.
Path 1: Jotun - Part 4
Path 1: Jotun - Part 5
Use stealth or just run fast past the gorillas. Run past Korga unless you think the group will wipe on the last boss and would want the closer WP.
Stealth and run.
Swiftness then run past the AoEs from the glowing stones.

Reflects are your friend. If no one has any, you can take the reflect crystals from the other parts and stand inside the hit box with it, and dodge once it breaks. Don't stand in lava founts, and the fire ring will down you if you cross it.
Path 1: Jotun - Part 6
Path 2: Mursaat - Start
Everyone stay close to the boss to avoid the oneshot orb attack. Use melee attacks, no projectiles. Use projectile reflect/destruction.
Path 2: Mursaat - Part 2
Use stealth and run past the spiders and abominations. Otherwise, you can use the powersuit to shove the spiders back. The guns will recharge the suit. Stealth and running will be faster.
Path 2: Mursaat - Part 3
More stealth.
Use tranq gun from inquest for enraged. Avoid the stomp, and rampage charge. Don't be ranged or get downed by rock attack.
Path 2: Mursaat - Part 4
Path 2: Mursaat - Part 5
All the white lumps are mines. There's also turrets that will immobilize you. Alternatively, you can run the right path past them.
Path 2: Mursaat - Mine Skip
Path 2: Mursaat - Part 6
Hide behind crate. Use projectile reflect or destruction. If you see red AoE circle, dodge.
Path 2: Mursaat - Part 7

One person use the terminal to be shifted, bring the boss down to 50%. Melee her and sidestep the laser attack. Other players can face their back to the shield and walk backwards into it to get through.
P3: Forgotten - Start
Prioritize the Wraithlord Crusher as he can revive the Hunter.
P3: Forgotten - Part 2
Stealth Recommended.
You want to stealth past the oneshot Spider. You do not want the Spider on the group when fighting the boss.
P3: Forgotten - Part 3
Current WP - Interact to Copy
Stealth and run past gorillas.
P3: Forgotten - Part 3
Stealth and run past.
Current WP - Interact to Copy
Ritual can be made easier with a kiter grabbing the mob aggro while someone with stealth caps the circles.
P4: Seer - Start
Kill the hounds and drop the orbs into the torches to summon the boss. Avoid spiny attacks and firestorms.
P4: Seer - Part 2
Avoid the green and falling rocks.
Stealth and outrun the oozes.
Stealth and mobs.
Stealth and mobs.
Take buckets and dump it on the stumps to make trees and summon the boss. Gorillas will respawn. Trees will root players. Use stab or dodge the knockback.
P4: Seer - Part 3
Stealth past spiders and hands to avoid aggro and knockdowns.
You can reflect the attacks. Might want condi cleanse.
P4: Seer - Part 4
Bring ranged and kill 3 Anti-air Cannons.

No projectiles for Phase 1. Stand in the wells and slap the Wraith when he ports. Don't shove him out or take too long to slap him. Continue until dead. Phase 2 you can leave the wells and slap more wraths until they die. If the mark expires, you downstate.
P4: Seer - Part 5
Stealth to avoid hand knockdowns and dodge the death red circles.
Lead sparks to the circles to trap them and start the fight. Use tears to break petrifaction on allies. Repeat until dead.
Tree Skip: Aim for the center of the trunk. Then move backwards while jumping. Then jump to the leaves. Then jump right of the root.
Don't fall off or through the holes.
Kill quickly to avoid the previous God's mechanics.
P4: Seer - Part 6 (Only if you can't tree skip, take the long way)

If there's a mesmer, have them run to the end and drop the portal before running back and placing one here to take the orb. Once grabbing the orb, blink to the portal spot and quickly open the portal.
Path to the Corrupted Light and Lupi
General: Path to Lupi
Stealth and run past
Fight the abominations in the corner.
You can push him back by standing in his red circle. Shove him into the wall and use a reflect on the wall while you fight him to cheese the mechanics.
